Articles.Content: Could you make a link to the origonal? I have no idea where to look for it....
Ragnarok Anchorage is an orbital Ion Cannon.
Very nice I ike it how long did ut take you?
Beautiful... I can't imagine how long the tracking station list would be.

Ragnarok Anchorage is an orbital Ion Cannon.

I doubt Ragnarok Anchorage in PfL is this. But the name did remind me of it.

Anchorage, "A location where a boat or other vessel lies at anchor"

Anything else is classified ;P
Will it ever become unclassified?
Only if you ask nicely
Pretty pretty please could you show us the classified info with sugar lumps and a Toblerone on top? With extra Toblerones?

Okay, more detailed info will be available on the vehicles list

Ragnarok Anchorage is a shipyard hidden in geosynchronous orbit and behind a huge sheet of matte black radar absorbing material. At this hidden station the VSA is constructing Kerbin's first space-going warships (The peaceful ones are built at Kyoto Space Station).

Built in secret to avoid public uproar from both the island and the mainland, these warships serve as the only line of defense against the greatest threat the Kerbal race has ever known...

We know how to bribe you Chobit

Appropriate name for the station. Now we wait in anticipation for information of that threat.

But how could you keep the rocket launches for the station secret?
Just looked at the mission map. Excellent work!
but ion cannons are cooool..

Okay, more detailed info will be available on the vehicles list

Ragnarok Anchorage is a shipyard hidden in geosynchronous orbit and behind a huge sheet of matte black radar absorbing material. At this hidden station the VSA is constructing Kerbin's first space-going warships (The peaceful ones are built at Kyoto Space Station).

Built in secret to avoid public uproar from both the island and the mainland, these warships serve as the only line of defense against the greatest threat the Kerbal race has ever known...

Cool!

... Let me guess! HUMANS!

Cool!

... Let me guess! HUMANS!

Oh, please. we haven't even put someone on Mars yet. The only manmade object to ever leave the solar system is Voyager I.

And it only officially exited the solar systems influence several months ago! (according to wikipedia)

Edited June 1, 2013 by Rage097

Is it me or is PfL progress much faster than before?

Edited June 1, 2013 by LeonG17

Cool!

... Let me guess! HUMANS!

You are so subtle with things aren't you Chobit...

Is that why you asked about the outer space treaties in KSP before? And why the Bop satellite and probe are classified?
I'm sorry, that's classified
We will find out eventually, because of Toblerones. Do you want any?
This is all yours if you tell us.

okay, more detailed info will be available on the vehicles list

ragnarok anchorage is a shipyard hidden in geosynchronous orbit and behind a huge sheet of matte black radar absorbing material. At this hidden station the vsa is constructing kerbin's first space-going warships (the peaceful ones are built at kyoto space station).

Built in secret to avoid public uproar from both the island and the mainland, these warships serve as the only line of defense against the greatest threat the kerbal race has ever known...

the kraken!

edit: but i was sniped

Edited June 1, 2013 by redwolfy
How did you ever guess?

the kraken!

No -censored-, sherlock!

-snip image that made me laugh-

I'm guessing there's a subtle difference between the red *CLASSIFIED* for the Bop probes and the blue *CLASSIFIED* for the Valhalla Anchorage.

Specifically, the use of red elsewhere is not an encouraging sign.

Also, are all of these based on missions you've actually flown in-game? Just idly curious.

EDIT: While I'm thinking about it, do you think you could make the mission icons available for download? I'm half-tempted to make one of these charts for my own space program, and I've already got the template for the chart itself.

EDIT2: The complete lack of missions to Tylo is also intriguing.

Edited June 1, 2013 by Specialist290
